column4: hi I am trying to make an app launcher. its runs from the terminal can I make some launcher that doesnt need launcher?
Dr_willis: I installed matlab and am trying to make a launcher for it
dr_willis: its not in the default location so the file from ubuntu help doesnt work
where do you want to put your launcher ?
desktop/panel
what command do you use when you run matlab ?
you can try using "gnome-terminal --command='matlab'" as the launcher's command
it also keeps the terminal open
yes, if matlab needs a terminal (for some weird reason), it will stay opened as long as matlab is running
Ctrl+F11 should put any window into fullscreen
not working
maybe it works only with metacity
I just added the shortcut to my keyboard shortcuts still doesnt work
do you use compiz ?
in that case, in ccsm, you can set a shortcut to toggle fullscreen in the "Extra WM Actions"
where?
run "ccsm", then in the "Window Management" section, you'll find "Extra WM Actions"
in WM is see app switcher move window place windows put resize ring switcher scale shift switcher snapping windows static app switcher and window rules
maybe this plugin is not part of compiz by default
I'm looking to find which package provides it
its ok my fullscreen will work
ok nice
how did you do ?
